title: "Unstable Situation": Indian Visa Centres In Bangladesh Closed Indefinitely
content: All Indian visa application centres in Bangladesh will remain closed until further notice after unrest in the neighbouring country forced Sheikh Hasina to resign as Prime Minister and flee the country.
summary: All Indian visa application centres in Bangladesh will remain closed until further notice after unrest in the neighbouring country forced Sheikh Hasina to resign as Prime Minister and flee the country.

title: Actor Shanto Khan, His Father Lynched During Unrest In Bangladesh
content: Actor Shanto Khan was lynched at Chandpur along with his father Selim Khan, owner of a renowned Bangladeshi production house.
summary: Actor Shanto Khan was lynched at Chandpur along with his father Selim Khan, owner of a renowned Bangladeshi production house.

title: "Heartbroken That I Can't See, Hug Her": Sheikh Hasina's Daughter
content: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's daughter today said she was "heartbroken" that she could not "see and hug her mother" after her ouster.
summary: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's daughter today said she was "heartbroken" that she could not "see and hug her mother" after her ouster.

title: Bangladesh Set To Get Interim Government Led By Nobel Winner Today
content: Bangladesh is set to get an interim government headed by Nobel Peace Prize-winning economist Muhammad Yunus today, days after Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina was forced to resign amid violent student protests.
summary: Bangladesh is set to get an interim government headed by Nobel Peace Prize-winning economist Muhammad Yunus today, days after Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina was forced to resign amid violent student protests.

title: Anti-Racism Protests Erupt In UK Amid Unrest After Far-Right Demonstrations
content: Thousands of anti-racism protesters have taken to the streets in many cities and towns of the UK to counter far-right demonstrations after days of unrest following Southport stabbing.
summary: Thousands of anti-racism protesters have taken to the streets in many cities and towns of the UK to counter far-right demonstrations after days of unrest following Southport stabbing.

title: Bangladesh New Interim PM Muhammad Yunus Heads Home, To Be Sworn In Today
content: Nobel Laureate economist Muhammad Yunus is expected to return to Bangladesh on Thursday, Bangladesh-based Dhaka Tribune reported.
summary: Nobel Laureate economist Muhammad Yunus is expected to return to Bangladesh on Thursday, Bangladesh-based Dhaka Tribune reported.

title: Tunisian President Sacks Prime Minister Without Any Explanation
content: Tunisian President Kais Saied sacked his Prime Minister Ahmed Hachani without explanation on Wednesday and replaced him with social affairs minister Kamel Madouri, his office said in a statement.
summary: Tunisian President Kais Saied sacked his Prime Minister Ahmed Hachani without explanation on Wednesday and replaced him with social affairs minister Kamel Madouri, his office said in a statement.

title: US Urges Israel To Probe Video Of Prison Sex Abuse
content: The United States on Wednesday urged Israel to investigate and implement accountability after a video appeared to show soldiers sexually abusing a Palestinian prisoner.
summary: The United States on Wednesday urged Israel to investigate and implement accountability after a video appeared to show soldiers sexually abusing a Palestinian prisoner.

title: Islamic Bloc Says Israel "Fully Responsible" For Hamas Chief's Death
content: Top Muslim diplomats on Wednesday said Israel was "fully responsible" for the "heinous" killing of Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh in Iran and warned it could destabilise the region.
summary: Top Muslim diplomats on Wednesday said Israel was "fully responsible" for the "heinous" killing of Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh in Iran and warned it could destabilise the region.

title: Ready To Work With Bangladesh Interim Government, Says US
content: The United States Wednesday said it is ready to work with the interim government of Bangladesh as the country charts a democratic future for its people.
summary: The United States Wednesday said it is ready to work with the interim government of Bangladesh as the country charts a democratic future for its people.

title: Taylor Swift's Vienna Shows Cancelled After Alleged Terror Attack Threat
content: The Vienna leg of a tour by American mega-star Taylor Swift has been cancelled after Austria arrested a man in connection with an Islamist attack plot, the organisers said Wednesday.
summary: The Vienna leg of a tour by American mega-star Taylor Swift has been cancelled after Austria arrested a man in connection with an Islamist attack plot, the organisers said Wednesday.

title: "If Trump Loses...": Biden Raises Concerns Over Peaceful Transfer Of Power
content: US President Joe Biden said an interview with CBS he is "not confident at all" there will be a peaceful transfer of power to Kamala Harris if Donald Trump loses November's election, according to an extract broadcast Wednesday.
summary: US President Joe Biden said an interview with CBS he is "not confident at all" there will be a peaceful transfer of power to Kamala Harris if Donald Trump loses November's election, according to an extract broadcast Wednesday.

title: Sunita Williams Could Return On Another Craft In February If Needed: NASA
content: NASA said on Wednesday that astronauts delivered to the International Space Station by Boeing's Starliner could return on SpaceX's Crew Dragon in February 2025 if Starliner is still deemed unsafe to return to Earth.
summary: NASA said on Wednesday that astronauts delivered to the International Space Station by Boeing's Starliner could return on SpaceX's Crew Dragon in February 2025 if Starliner is still deemed unsafe to return to Earth.

title: Bangladesh Garment Factories Reopen After Sheikh Hasina Ousted
content: Garment factories in Bangladesh, forecast to account for 90% of the country's exports, reopened on Wednesday after production was disrupted by violent protests that ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina this week.
summary: Garment factories in Bangladesh, forecast to account for 90% of the country's exports, reopened on Wednesday after production was disrupted by violent protests that ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina this week.

title: Israel Vows To "Eliminate" New Hamas Chief As War Enters 11th Month
content: Israel vowed to "eliminate" new Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar, the alleged mastermind of the October 7 attack, whose appointment further inflamed regional tensions as the Gaza war entered its 11th month on Wednesday.
summary: Israel vowed to "eliminate" new Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar, the alleged mastermind of the October 7 attack, whose appointment further inflamed regional tensions as the Gaza war entered its 11th month on Wednesday.

title: How China Reacted To Kamal Harris' Running Mate Pick Tim Walz
content: US presidential candidate Kamala Harris's choice of Tim Walz as her running mate has raised eyebrows, and plenty of questions, in China, which he first visited in 1989, the year the military crushed pro-democracy protests.
summary: US presidential candidate Kamala Harris's choice of Tim Walz as her running mate has raised eyebrows, and plenty of questions, in China, which he first visited in 1989, the year the military crushed pro-democracy protests.

title: Bangladesh Interim Caretaker Acquitted Of Labour Charges Before Swearing-In
content: A Bangladeshi court on Wednesday overturned a conviction against Mohammed Yunus, a day before the Nobel winner is set to return to lead a caretaker government.
summary: A Bangladeshi court on Wednesday overturned a conviction against Mohammed Yunus, a day before the Nobel winner is set to return to lead a caretaker government.

title: Israel Issues Evacuation Orders In North Gaza After Fresh Hamas Strikes
content: Israeli forces on Wednesday issued new evacuation orders to Palestinians in areas of north Gaza after Hamas operatives fired a fresh volley of rockets into Israel.
summary: Israeli forces on Wednesday issued new evacuation orders to Palestinians in areas of north Gaza after Hamas operatives fired a fresh volley of rockets into Israel.

title: Son Of Norway Crown Princess Arrested For Assault Woman: Cops
content: The 27-year-old son of Norwegian Crown Princess Mette-Marit was arrested at the weekend on suspicion of assaulting a woman, police said on Wednesday.
summary: The 27-year-old son of Norwegian Crown Princess Mette-Marit was arrested at the weekend on suspicion of assaulting a woman, police said on Wednesday.

title: Drop Charges Against Bangladesh Ex-PM  Party Leader Living In India
content: Sheikh Hasina ousted, all eyes in Bangladesh are on the main opposition party - the Bangladesh National party or BNP, whose top leader -- former Prime minister Begum Khaleda Zia  has been released from house arrest.
summary: Sheikh Hasina ousted, all eyes in Bangladesh are on the main opposition party - the Bangladesh National party or BNP, whose top leader -- former Prime minister Begum Khaleda Zia  has been released from house arrest.
